item.title: St. Louis Park Vapor Intrusion Site
item.description:
On this page
  • Site Update
  • Documents
  • Site Background
  • Cleanup
  • Location
  • Contamination
  • Cooperating Agencies

Site Update

March 2016

U.S. Environmental Protection Agency completed a vapor intrusion study and removal action in the neighborhood of St. Louis Park in June 2008.

Top of Page

Documents

  • Fact Sheets and Letter to Residents
  • Technical and Legal Documents: St. Louis Park Highway 7

Top of Page

Site Background

In 2005 and 2006, samples of ground water taken in St. Louis Park by the Minnesota Pollution Control Agency were found to contain VOCs. That prompted more tests to find out if the soil contained vapors from the VOCs. These vapors can move up through the soil and into the basements of homes and other buildings. This process is called vapor intrusion.

The study done by EPA and several other local and state agencies involved testing the soil underneath homes and businesses for the presence of vapors from VOCs. If soil vapor levels were high then indoor air samples were also taken. Vapor extraction systems were installed in homes found with elevated levels of VOC fumes.

EPA took soil vapor samples from beneath the foundations of 220 homes and 49 businesses. Of the 220 homes sampled, 41 were found to have elevated levels of VOCs. Of the businesses, 12 had elevated levels. In response, EPA took indoor air samples at all but one of those locations (one resident denied access). Results from the indoor air sampling showed the presence of elevated levels of VOCs in

16 of the properties (11 residential and five commercial).

Top of Page

Cleanup

EPA offered vapor extraction systems to those homeowners with elevated levels of VOCs in their indoor air or in the soil beneath their homes. These systems were then installed by EPA at no charge to the homeowner. All property owners had the final say as to what happened at their property. Forty home vapor extraction systems were installed. EPA also explained to the commercial property owners what types of measures the owner could take to address the vapors. These measures will be the financial responsibility of the commercial property owner.

Top of Page

Location

The Highway 7 & Wooddale Avenue Soil Vapor Study Areas are located near the intersection of Highway 7 and Wooddale Avenue in St. Louis Park, Minn.

Top of Page

Contamination

Volatile organic compounds are a group of chemicals used in solvents, paints and dry-cleaning fluid.  Breathing low levels of VOCs for long periods may cause an increase in health risks.

Top of Page

Cooperating Agencies

The following agencies worked together to address the vapor intrusion removal:

  • U.S. Environmental Protection Agency
  • Minnesota Pollution Control Agency
  • Minnesota Department of Health
  • Hennepin County
  • City of St. Louis Park
item.dc:creator: ypina

item.title: Contact EPA About Petition for NPDES Program Withdrawal
item.description:
Report a Violation

Report possible violations of environmental laws and regulations.

Please use the form below to send us attachment requests and general comments or questions about the WaterLegacy petition for NPDES program withdrawal in Minnesota. Be sure to include your e-mail address if you’d like a response.
item.dc:creator: anowotar

item.title: Environmental Data Maps for Minnesota
item.description:
ECHO

Use EPA's ECHO website to search for facilities in your community to assess their compliance with environmental regulations. You can also investigate pollution sources, examine and create enforcement-related maps, or explore your state's performance. Learn more about ECHO.

item.title: NPDES Petition for Program Withdrawal in Minnesota
item.description:
Documents related to the WaterLegacy Petition for NPDES Program Withdrawal in Minnesota

You can request the attachments for the supplement to the petition.

  • Water Legacy response to August 12, 2016, Attorney General statement (PDF)(55 pp, 599 K, August 19, 2016)
  • Attorney General statement regarding MPCA’s Legal Authority to Implement its Authorized NDPES program (PDF)(5 pp, 754 K, August 12, 2016)
  • July 2016 WaterLegacy Update to NPDES Withdrawal Petition (PDF)(4 pp, 181 K, July 13, 2016)
  • MPCA's response to EPA's June 22 letter (PDF)(2 pp, 79 K, July 13, 2016)
  • MPCA's Legal Authority to Implement its Authorized NPDES Program While Working Under Laws of Minnesota 2016, Chapter 165, Section 1 (PDF)(3 pp, 651 K, June 28, 2016)
  • MPCA Intent for Mining Operation (PDF)(4 pp, 645 K, June 22, 2016)
  • EPA grants extension for MPCA to provide AG’s statement (PDF)(1 pg, 158 K, May 9, 2016)
  • MPCA's request for an extension to provide AG’s Statement (PDF)(1 pg, 39 K, May 2, 2016)
  • EPA's request for an Attorney General statement regarding MPCA's Legal Authority to Implement its Authorized NPDES Program While Working Under Laws of Minnesota 2015, 1st Spec. Sess. Chapter 4, Aritcle 4, Section 136 (PDF)(2 pp, 430 K, April 5, 2016)
  • EPA Request for Documents Pertaining to EPA's Investigation of Allegations Presented in the WaterLegacy Petition for Withdrawal of Program Delegation from the State of Minnesota for NPDES Permits Related to Mining Facilities (PDF)(2 pp, 570 K, April 4, 2016)
  • Final Protocol for Responding to Issues Related to Permitting and Enforcement presented in the WaterLegacy Petition for Withdrawal of Program Delegation from the State of Minnesota for NPDF,S Permits Related to Mining Facilities (PDF)(7 pp, 2 MB, March 8, 2016)
    March 8, 2016 letter
  • Supplement to WaterLegacy Petition (PDF)(7 pp, 199 K, October 27, 2015)
  • WaterLegacy Cover Letter (PDF)(2 pp, 164 K, July 2, 2015)
  • WaterLegacy Petition for Withdrawal (PDF)(33 pp, 321 K, July 2, 2015)
  • Petition Exhibits (PDF)(445 pp, 11 MB, July 2, 2015)

item.title: Tentative Decision Granting FibroMinn's Application for a Non-Waste Determination - July 14, 2015
item.description:
regarding FibroMinn LLC application for a non-waste determination under RCRA Non-Hazardous Secondary Materials Rule

  • Tentative Decision Granting FibroMinn's Application for a Non-Waste Determination (PDF)(1 pg, 37 K, July 14, 2015)
item.dc:creator: kreshkin

item.title: FibroMinn fact sheet: Preliminary Decision Aids Biomass Energy Plant
item.description:
U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is proposing to grant FibroMinn LLC’s request that the poultry litter burned at the company’s power plant in Benson, Minnesota, be considered a non-waste fuel. This is the first EPA response to a non-waste petition in the country under the Non-Hazardous Secondary Material Rule.

  • Preliminary Decision Aids Biomass Energy Plant (PDF)(1 pg, 129 K, July 2015)
item.dc:creator: kreshkin
